title: How do set top boxes receive TV program information? - Quora

response.answer_text: STB receives program information will call it is EPG(Electronic program guide) In both DVB C and DVB S type network. EIT(Event information table) will receive to Headend from the service broadcaster. In HE will arrange according to channel and same table (data) call it in STB with the help of programming and UI development. Two types of EPG are available, Main EPG - shows all channels/service informationMini EPG - shows current running channel information

They’re basically computers, connected to the main server. That’s why you need a cable wire. To deliver the images, sound, and information. Once connected, it’s no different than going online to get info. Except the cable box goes to the company’s server, instead of having a choice like Google or Bing. It’s also preprogrammed to request info when the cable guide is accessed.
